body:
Comment 1 by **jdnurmi**: 
As an edit to this -- while I can't come up with a reason, it might be necessary for
someone to actually utilize this functionality.

If that's the case, then I see one of two reasonable outcomes:

1) Create a Digest() function that returns the Sum() with a new digest, and sum that
returns the cached value so long as Sum() hasn't changed.

2) /Clearly/ document that .Sum on an hmac.Hash is not idempotent -- this is actually
completely contrary to the hash.New() docs, so deserves metion.  While the underlying
functionality differs, having Sum() move from idempotent to not under the same type is
confusing.
